io.amelia.support

Class Encrypt

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.amelia.support.Encrypt

  • public class Encrypt
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides basic encryption and randomizing functions

      • getDigest

        public static java.security.MessageDigest getDigest(java.lang.String algorithm)
        Returns a MessageDigest for the given algorithm.
        Parameters:
        algorithm - the name of the algorithm requested. See Appendix A in the Java Cryptography Architecture API Specification & Reference for information about standard algorithm names.
        Returns:
        A digest instance.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when a NoSuchAlgorithmException is caught.
        See Also:
        MessageDigest.getInstance(String)

      • randomize

        public static char randomize()
        Selects a random character within range 33-126, 128, 131, 134, 135, 138, 140, 142, 156, 158, 159, 161, 162, 163, 165, 167, 176, 181, 191, and 192-255
        Returns:
        The randomly selected character

      • randomize

        public static char randomize(char chr)
        Takes the input character and scrambles it
        Parameters:
        chr - Random base character
        A-Z will result in a random uppercase character
        a-z will result in a random lowercase character
        0-9 will result in a random number character
        All others will result in a random symbol or accented character
        Returns:
        Randomized character based on the original

      • randomize

        public static char randomize(int start,
                             int end)
        Selects a random character between 0-255 using specified start and end arguments
        Parameters:
        start - The minimum character to select
        end - The maximum character to select
        Returns:
        The randomly selected character

      • randomize

        public static java.lang.String randomize(java.util.Random rando,
                                         java.lang.String base)

      • randomize

        public static java.lang.String randomize(java.lang.String base)
        Takes each character of the provided string and scrambles it
        Example: 0xx0000$X could result in 9at6342&Z
        Parameters:
        base - The base pattern to follow
        A-Z will result in a random uppercase character
        a-z will result in a random lowercase character
        0-9 will result in a random number character
        All others will result in a random symbol or accented character
        Returns:
        String randomized using your original base string
